subject: Leadership
title: Identifying Assumptions
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Identifying Assumptions.

hook.text: Kodak assumed people would always want printed photos. They invented digital cameras but shelved them. Fatal assumption.

buildup.text: Every strategy rests on assumptions about customers, markets, and technology. Unchecked assumptions become blind spots.

discovery.text: Strategic leaders explicitly name their assumptions and create mechanisms to test them before committing resources.

twist.text: The most dangerous assumptions are the ones so obvious nobody questions them. 'Everyone knows' is a red flag.

climax.text: Build an assumption audit into planning: list what must be true, assign owners to validate, and set review triggers.

punchline.text: Assumptions are invisible until they break. Surface them first.

quiz.question: Why is identifying assumptions critical to strategy?
options: It eliminates the need for data
